headline: TARIFF PAUSE SPURS GLOBAL MANUFACTURING ACTIVITY IN JUNE, WITH GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAINS NOW OPERATING CLOSE TO FULL CAPACITY: GEP GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAIN VOLATILITY INDEX
summary: GEP Global Supply Chain Volatility Index — a leading indicator tracking demand conditions, shortages, transportation costs, inventories, and backlogs based on a monthly survey of 27,000 businesses — jumped to -0.17 in June, from -0.46 in May, its highest in 2025 as worldwide supply chain activity picked up despite the 10% tariffs imposed by the US administration.

headline: UK's CMA considers probe into S&P Global /ORBCOMM AIS merger
summary: July 11 -UK's CMA: Competition and Mkts - merger update: S&P Global/ORBCOMM AIS UK's CMA: considering whether S&P Global/ORBCOMM AIS transaction will result in creation of a relevant merger...
